wikipedia_page.main: John Pugsley (born 1 April 1900) was a Welsh footballer who played in the Football League for Grimsby Town, Bristol City and Charlton Athletic.

response: *John Pugsley  Cardiff City FC & Wales national football player, born in Grangetown

link_mentions.page: List of Charlton Athletic F.C. players

response: In Common Sense Economics Pugsley cites as influences Murray Rothbard, Henry Hazlitt, and Ludwig von Mises,Pugsley, John, Common Sense Economics. The Common Sense Press, 1976, p. v-vi and subsequent works also cite Andrew J. Galambos. In 1995 he authored an open letter to Harry Browne advising him against running for president; Pugsley's argument was based on the principles of voluntaryism and non-voting.Pugsley, John, "An Open Letter from John Pugsley to Harry Browne: Harry Browne, Please Don't Run For President", published in The Voluntaryist number 74, June 1995, p. 1-7.

In 1975 he began a newsletter on economic and political events, Common Sense Viewpoint (1974), which had 30,000 subscribers at its peak. In 1988 he began publishing John Pugsley's Journal, an investment-economic newsletter covering political, economic, and investment topics.A brief biography of John A. Pugsley
